name: Tomato and Garlic Pasta
author: ALMA-LOU
summary: There is nothing nicer than the flavor of fresh tomatoes. You can use canned, but the trouble you take to prepare this dish is worth it. You prepare the sauce while the pasta is cooking, no long hours of waiting. Great if you want meatless pasta.
directions: Place tomatoes in a kettle, and cover with cold water
Pour off water, and cover again with cold water
Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente
In a large skillet or saute pan, saute the garlic in enough olive oil to cover the bottom of the pan
The garlic should just become opaque, not brown
Immediately stir in the tomatoes, and salt and pepper
Reduce heat, and simmer until the pasta is ready; add the basil
Drain the pasta, but do not rinse in cold water
Toss with a couple of tablespoons of olive oil, and then mix into the sauce
Reduce the heat as low as possible
Keep warm, uncovered, for about 10 minutes when it is ready to serve
Garnish generously with fresh Parmesan cheese
VARIATIONS:  Saute fresh quartered mushrooms with the garlic, or add shoestring zucchini along with the tomato
